wikipedia_page.main: William George Nicholson Geddes CBE DSc FRSE FEng (29 July 1913 – 10 November 1993) was a Scottish civil engineer.

response: * William George Nicholson Geddes (1913–1993), civil engineer
*William George Nicholson Geddes (1913–1993), Scottish civil engineer
*William George Nicholson Geddes (1913–1993), Scottish civil engineer
James Arthur Banks and William George Nicholson Geddes both became President of the Institution of Civil Engineers while partners in the firm.

The dam was designed by William George Nicholson Geddes, as directed by James Arthur Banks of Babtie, Shaw and Morton of Glasgow.Engineering Timelines Construction was carried out by Marples Ridgway. It was completed in 1956 and has a height of 22 metres.
* 29 July – William George Nicholson Geddes, civil engineer (died 1993)
* William George Nicholson Geddes, Senior Partner, Messrs. Babtie, Shaw & Morton, Consulting Civil and Structural Engineers, Glasgow.
In 1987 he was elected a Fellow of the Royal Society of Edinburgh. His proposers were Hugh B Sutherland, Prof Alexander Coull, William George Nicholson Geddes and John Atwell.
